name: ext_R4B_Consent_pr_action
title: Cross-version Extension for R4B.Consent.provision.action for use in FHIR R3
description: This cross-version extension represents Consent.provision.action from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Consent|4.3.0 for use in FHIR R3.

element.comment: `Consent.provision.action` maps to R3 `Consent.action`. To multiple elements in Consent: (`Consent.action`, `Consent.except.action`). So is mapped as SourceIsBroaderThanTarget. `Consent.provision.action` maps to R3 `Consent.except.action`. To multiple elements in Consent: (`Consent.action`, `Consent.except.action`). So is mapped as SourceIsBroaderThanTarget.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
